items.content_html:
CSS module landing page refresh to new template.

there are some properties that are listed in both the reference under 'properties' and under related content under box alignment. This is intentional as they are definitely flex properties, but the box alignment definitions supersede the flexbox. Didn't want to remove them from either list.

addressed as part of CSS baseline / interop openwebdocs/project#189 - subcomponent openwebdocs/project#202
items.title: CSS module: flexible box layout

items.content_html:
This merges RTCRtpCodecParameters into the places where it is used - RTCRtpReceiver.getParameters(), RTCRtpSender.getParameters(), RTCRtpTransceiver.setCodecPreferences(), RTCRtpSender: setParameters()

I still have to fix up the cross links from the stats objects and then delete RTCRtpCodecParameters

This is part of "getting docs to standard" for #33988
items.title: RTCRtpCodecParameters - removal - merge into where it is used

items.content_html:
just freshens up the guide.

  • remove historical information
  • de-capitalize to match mdn guidelines
  • checked stuff to make sure it was accurate (and it mostly was)
  • removed "fallback" type language.
  • display contents was fixed, then it wasn't, then it was partially, so made the warning more generic so it stands the test of time

addressed as part of CSS baseline / interop openwebdocs/project#189 - subcomponent openwebdocs/project#202
items.title: Maintenance: CSS flex guide: updates to guide 2

items.content_html:
Flexbox is not longer new, and there have been values and properties added since this guide was written. This update adds the missing values and properties, and just freshens up the guide.

addressed as part of CSS baseline / interop openwebdocs/project#189 - subcomponent openwebdocs/project#202
items.title: Maintenance: CSS flex guide: updates to guide 1

items.content_html:
Description

  • improvements on existing WAI, ATAG, WCAG, ARIA glossary
  • added UAAG entry, part of the Accessibility Guidelines series purposed by WAI

Relates to #34143
items.title: feat: improvements on WAI and related standards/recommendations

items.content_html:
FF128 supports RTCRtpTransceiver.setCodecPreferences() in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1396922

This adds a release note.

Related docs work can be tracked in #33981
items.title: FF128Relnote: RTCRtpTransceiver.setCodecPreferences() supported

items.content_html:
Updates to CSS property align-items:

  • text case and links to comply with MDN writing guidelines
  • move flex only values to the end of the values list
  • Add text around example to explain what is going on.
  • hide code not relevant to the property being discussed.
  • add colors to grid and flex so the user can see that the value has changed.

addressed as part of CSS baseline / interop openwebdocs/project#189 - subcomponent openwebdocs/project#202
items.title: CSS property update: align-items

items.content_html:
• add applicable properties
  • add description (with flex direction explanation)
  • see also

addressed as part of CSS baseline / interop openwebdocs/project#189 - subcomponent openwebdocs/project#202
items.title: CSS property update: gap

items.content_html:
Description

  • separate asynchronous into two sub-glossary entries
  • improvements on description on both entries.
items.title: feat: improvements on glossary Asynchoronous

items.content_html:
Description

Addresses the documentation requirements of Bug 1889897 Implement asyncBlocking support for webRequest.onAuthRequired, including:

  • a release note
  • update to the webRequest.onAuthRequired event documentation. This also included some changes to avoid repetition in that documentation.
items.title: asyncBlocking in webRequest.onAuthRequired

items.content_html:
FF128 ships growable SharedArrayBuffer and resizable ArrayBuffer in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1884150

This adds a release note and removes the experimental feature record.

Related docs work can be tracked in #33983
items.title: FF128 ReleaseNote/Expr Features -

Dependabot will merge this PR once CI passes on it, as requested by @mdn-bot.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot show <dependency name> ignore conditions will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: Bump @mdn/yari from 2.55.0 to 2.56.0

items.content_html:
Note: MERGE the corresponding demo updates in mdn/dom-examples#265 as soon as this content has been merged, otherwise the demo links in the content will be broken.

Description

Background information

#32723 contains the engineering technical review for my work on cross-document view transitions docs, which has been completed and approved. Thank you to @bramus for your thorough and detailed review work.

This is a new PR based on the same branch, which is intended to contain the editorial review for the same work.

Description

Chrome 123/124 includes features required for developers to create cross-document View Transitions. This includes:

  • The PageRevealEvent interface
  • The pagereveal event
  • The PageSwapEvent interface
  • The pageswap event
  • The NavigationActivation interface
  • The @view-transition at rule
  • <link rel="expect">

This PR adds content for all of these. In addition, it:

  • Updates the View Transitions API landing page to cover these new features.
  • Moves the guide content to a separate "Using the View Transitions API" article.
  • Makes some updates to existing view transitions pages, so that they work for SPA and MPA use cases.

Related ChromeStatus entries:

  • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5118874666663936
  • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5205586941837312
  • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5113053598711808

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Editorial review: cross-document view transitions

items.content_html:
Clarified the targetOrigin parameter to specify the intended recipient window and updated references to "any window" to denote contentWindow within the iframe hierarchy. Added enhanced security notes to improve understanding of postMessage usage and limitations.

Description

Clarified the targetOrigin parameter to specify the intended recipient window and updated references to "any window" to denote contentWindow within the iframe hierarchy. Added enhanced security notes to improve understanding of postMessage usage and limitations.

Motivation

These changes improve the clarity and accuracy of the documentation for window.postMessage(). By specifying what is meant by "this window" and "any window", readers can better understand the correct usage and security implications of the postMessage method.

Additional details

This update ensures that the documentation accurately reflects the behavior and security considerations of the postMessage method, helping developers to use it correctly and securely.

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #34090
items.title: Updated the description of `targetOrigin`  to specify the intended re…
